CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Output.​Components.​JSSummaryData
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Output.​Components.​JSSummaryData

A helper class to build JavaScript summary data for Output.Builders.HTML.  See <JavaScript Summary Data> and <JavaScript ToolTip Data> for the output formats.

Usage

  • Create a JSSummaryData object.

  • Call Build().

Threading: Not Thread Safe

This class is only designed to be used by one thread at a time.  It has an internal state that is used during a call to Build(), and another Build() should not be started until it's completed.  Instead each thread should create its own object.

public JSSummaryData (

)
Build
public void Build (
IList<Topic> topics,
IList<Link> links,
string fileTitle,
string fileHashPath,
Path summaryPath,
Path summaryToolTipsPath
)

Builds the JavaScript metadata for the Topic and appends it to the passed StringBuilder.

Parameters
topics
IList<Topic>

The Topics that appear in this file.

links
IList<Link>

A list of Links that includes everything that appears in the topic bodies.

fileTitle
string

The title of the file.

fileHashPath
string

The hash path of the file.

summaryPath
Path

A path to the summary metadata file to build.

summaryToolTipsPath
Path

A path to the summary tooltips metadata file to build.

The HTMLTopicPage associated with this summary file.

The JavaScript being generated.

fileTitle

protected string fileHashPath
topics
protected IList<Topic> topics

The Topic list for the file we're building.

protected IList<Link> links

A list of Links that includes everything appearing in topics.

htmlTopic
protected HTMLTopic htmlTopic

A HTMLTopic to build tooltips.

usedLanguages
protected List<Language> usedLanguages

A list of the languages used in topics.  The order in which they appear here will be the order in which they appear in the JavaScript array.

usedCommentTypes
protected List<CommentType> usedCommentTypes

A list of the comment types used in topics.  The order in which they appear here will be the order in which they appear in the JavaScript array.

htmlComponent
protected HTMLComponent htmlComponent

A private HTMLComponent object used for building wrapped titles.
